Participants.evidence: for studies on preoperative GLP-1 RA use in adults undergoing elective surgery.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of preoperative glucagon-like peptide-1 receptor agonists (GLP-1 RA) in elective surgical systems.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was perioperative safety, defined as any complication within 90 days post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Most studies were single-centre observational cohorts from high-income countries, with no randomised trials identified.

Blinding.evidence: Most studies were single-centre observational cohorts from high-income countries, with no randomised trials identified.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Most studies were single-centre observational cohorts from high-income countries, with no randomised trials identified.

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 21 studies, involving 97,059 patients, met inclusion criteria; 31.9% (n = 30,981) received preoperative GLP-1 RA therapy.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Postoperative complications were reported in 12 studies, with no increased risk in GLP-1 users (pooled OR: 0.78, 95% CI: 0.59–1.05).

Harms.evidence: Postoperative complications were reported in 12 studies, with no increased risk in GLP-1 users.

Trial_Registration.evidence: The study is registered with PROSPERO, CRD420251027809.

Funding.evidence: Funding: NIHR Doctoral Research Fellowship and NIHR Exeter Biomedical Research Centre Senior Investigator Fellowship.
